subject: Marketing
title: The Zeigarnik Effect
description: A fast breakdown of The Zeigarnik Effect for builders.

hook.text: Waiters remember incomplete orders perfectly but forget completed ones instantly.

buildup.text: The Zeigarnik effect says unfinished tasks occupy mental space until they're resolved.

discovery.text: Copywriters use open loopsâ€”starting stories they don't finish until laterâ€”to keep readers engaged.

twist.text: TV cliffhangers use the same principle. The unresolved tension demands you come back.

climax.text: Copy that creates and resolves loops strategically keeps attention through even long formats.

punchline.text: Start something unfinished. They'll stay to see it done.

quiz.question: What is the Zeigarnik effect?
options: Unfinished tasks occupy mental space until resolved
People forget everything they read within minutes
Completed tasks become more memorable over time
